p.codeblock: Future<void> enableLoopbackRecording( {required bool enabled, String? deviceName});
public abstract int EnableLoopbackRecording(bool enabled, string deviceName = "");

section.p: After enabling loopback recording, the sound played by the sound card will be mixed into the local audio stream and can be sent to the remote side.
After enabling the sound card capture function, the sound played by the sound card is mixed into the local audio stream and can be sent to the remote side.
After enabling loopback recording, the sound played by the sound card will be mixed into the local audio stream and can be sent to the remote end.

ul.li: This method can be called before or after joining a channel.
If you call to disable the audio module, loopback recording will also be disabled. To re-enable loopback recording, you need to call to enable the audio module and then call again.
This method is only applicable to macOS and Windows platforms.
This method can be called before or after joining a channel.
If you call to disable the audio module, the sound card capture function will also be disabled. To re-enable it, you must call to enable the audio module, and then call again.
This method is only applicable to macOS and Windows platforms.
It can be called before or after joining a channel.
If you call to disable the audio module, loopback recording will also be disabled. To re-enable loopback recording, you must call to enable the audio module, then call again.

plentry.pd:
Whether to enable loopback recording:
: Enable loopback recording; the system sound > output interface displays the virtual sound card name.
: (Default) Disable loopback recording; the system sound > output interface does not display the virtual sound card name.

pd.note: Electron for UnionTech OS SDK does not support this parameter.

ul.li: macOS: The device name of the virtual sound card. Default is empty, which means using the AgoraALD virtual sound card for recording.
Windows: The device name of the sound card. Default is empty, which means using the built-in sound card of the device.

plentry.pd:
Whether to enable sound card capture:
: Enable sound card capture; the virtual sound card name is displayed in System Sound > Output.
: (Default) Disable sound card capture; the virtual sound card name is not displayed in System Sound > Output.

ul.li: macOS: Device name of the virtual sound card. Default is empty, which means using the AgoraALD virtual sound card for capture.
Windows: Device name of the sound card. Default is empty, which means using the built-in sound card of the device for capture.

plentry.pd:
Whether to enable loopback recording:
: Enable loopback recording; the system sound > output interface displays the virtual sound card name.
: (Default) Disable loopback recording; the system sound > output interface does not display the virtual sound card name.

ul.li: macOS: The device name of the virtual sound card. Default is empty, which means using the AgoraALD virtual sound card for recording.
Windows: The device name of the sound card. Default is empty, which means using the built-in sound card of the device for recording.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
